newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly up.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly up.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Monday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.
Traders said the rates moved up today after the People's Bank of China, the central bank, was quoted as saying that the nation's interest rates were currently at appropriate levels.

The China Securities newspaper quoted a central bank spokesman as making the comment in response to speculation that another rate cut was likely before the end of this year. The bank cut bank interest rates in May and August.
But traders said trading was slow with state banks doing less business before the year-end.
They expect the rates to move in a narrow range in the short term. -- Shanghai newsroom (86-21) 6279-7004
